title: Andy Ledesma GarcÃ­a
subtitle: CTO & Computer Scientist & Blockchain Developer & Back-end Developer

blocks.data: Born on September 9th, 1999 in Cuba within a humble family. My family taught me useful lessons and the love for science.

My dad taught me chess when I was 4 years old, and by 11, I was already the best in my area. Thanks to this, I developed strong abstract thinking from an early age. PS: He used to beat me back then, now I win ðŸ˜Ž.
In September 2014, I began my studies at the Exact Sciences Institute Vladimir I. Lenin, where I focused on science and learned programming in C++.
I started competing in programming contests at age 15, mastering C++ to tackle advanced algorithms and data structures, and ranked in the top 11 nationally for my age in 2016.
blocks.caption: with Enrique and David

blocks.data: In December 2022, I graduated with a degree in Computer Science from the University of Havana, ranking 6th in my class. I took optional blockchain courses and developed a decentralized voting system on Quorum (an Ethereum fork) as my thesis.
In January 2023, I joined the Fusyona team, working for over two years on DeFi, SciFi, and GameFi protocols, collaborating closely with LayerZero, SKALE, Taraxa, and Sei.

From February 2023 to September 2024, I taught undergraduate Computer Science and Data Science curricula at the University of Havana, delivering advanced Database Systems and Computer Architecture courses to approximately 150 students, and mentored a blockchain research project, supervising thesis development.
On December 12, 2024, I moved to Dubai to take my career to the next level, leveraging first-world infrastructure and resources to become more efficient at work.
Near the end of December 2024, I joined the TokenFleet team, working on both backend and frontend code and developing smart contracts to power the TokenFleet RWA protocol.
During Token2049 Week (April 27â€“May 4, 2025), I showcased the TokenFleet projects to investors, marketers, and engineers, forging valuable connections and sparking exciting collaborations.

As a volunteer at EthDubai 2025, I was part of the staff that welcomed every investor, speaker, and attendee. We provided IDs and guidance for a seamless stay, maintained security, and resolved any issues to ensure smooth conferences and talks.
